channel.title: A good laser pen?
channel.description:
hi all,
i wanted a decent strong laser pen that I can mess around with, but i dont know whats the difference between v2 etc etc,
http://www.amazon.co.uk/s/ref=nb_ss_w_h_?url=search-alias%3Daps&field-keywords=laser+pen&x=0&y=0
could someone link me to a cheap one on amazon that is powerful?
Thanks

item.title: A good laser pen?
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

[quote=“I james I, post:8, topic:274934”]for this one:

http://www.amazon.co.uk/TeckNet-Kaleidoscopic-Green-Laser-Pointer/dp/B000SUPAC0/ref=cm_cd_pdp?_encoding=UTF8&cdPage=1&newContentID=TxAW4DT8BZ9W0K#CustomerDiscussions

it says: The diffraction grating also makes the laser safer as the beam is split into over 100 beams

does that mean that it can’t be used as a normal laser?

Thanks[/quote]

i recently bought this same laser pen that you just linked to.
iv only had it for about 2 weeks now, but im quite happy with it so far.

the diffraction grating can easily be unscrewed and used as a normal laser, i think they only include that because the UK has some odd laws on laser pens, and they have to make it a diffraction grating to exploit some loophole in the law.

30mW is quite powerful for a laser like this, dont let the milli- fool you, its very concentrated.
dont shine it at anyone or at any windows in case it bounces back into your eyes.

also, these lasers dont have IR filters, so dont assume they’re safe just because the laser beam isnt going into anyones eyes.

also, if you leave the batterys in when you’re not using it, they get drained, so only put them in when you’re using it.

Read full topic

item.title: A good laser pen?
item.dc:creator: @I_james_I I james I
item.description:
@I_james_I wrote:

one of the views: This is really good if you have a tight budget, nothing special but it hasnt fell and its vertical, hasnt covered up any sockets or USB ports or anything like that. Really good, accept, it attracts CRAZY ammounts of dust. So if you are being bombarded by the credit crunch, buy this! but expect lots and lots lots and lots lots and lots lots and lots lots and lots lots and lots lots and lots lots and lots of dust. explain?i dont get the dust., will it shine in the sky???

http://www.amazon.co.uk/TeckNet-Kaleidoscopic-Green-Laser-Pointer/dp/B000SUPAC0/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1240429605&sr=8-1
